question: In ancient India, the 8 smaller clans / kingdoms called “Athakula” belonged to which among the following Mahajanapadas?
explanation: Vajji or Vriji was located on the north of River Ganga in Bihar. The seat of 8 smaller clans / kingdoms called “Athakula” out of which Lichhavais, Janatriks, Videhas were very important. It was separated from Kosala from river Gandak.
